page.title: 05CHANGES IN CHAPEL-E-L-FRITH
page.content: The main change has been an increase in house-building but a decrease in amenities. New houses have been built at each end of the town catering for young couples & families. 60% are private & 40% council-owned.Materials used are natural stone & brick. The population has increased to 7750. Young couples have become residents, many being commuters.Several factories have closed but Ferodo Ltd.the main employer is now engaging more workers. There are good prospects for new industrial estates as Chapel is designated a rural development area. Three all-age schools have become infant,junior & comprehensive repect- ively;junior & senior being completely new buildings.There are various play- groups,one using an unused terrapin building at the junior school.(From an interview with a local councillor).
